instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3302: What is 820-3302? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
Hello, IMAC came in with no boot in the first place. replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> and start up now.
right now i have FAN Spin but no chime and no image, only LED 1 and 2 comes up. i have VCore on both CPU and GPU(0.8V). what else do i check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>GPU_GOOD</SIGNAL> not present?
Check power good signals for all GPU related power supplies; like in pages 60/74/80.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_EN_REG_GPUCORE_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.27
<SIGNAL>PM_EN_REG_GPU_VDDQ_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.27
<SIGNAL>PM_EN_REG_GPU_P1V05_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.27
PP1V5R1V35_S0_GPU_REG = 1.5v
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_GPU_REG</SIGNAL> = 1.05v
<SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_REG_GPU_VDDQ_S0</SIGNAL> = 3.27
<SIGNAL>PM_PGOOD_REG_P1V05_GPU</SIGNAL> = 3.27
<SIGNAL>PPGPUCORE_S0_REG</SIGNAL> = 0.9
<SIGNAL>GPU_GOOD</SIGNAL> = 0
hmmmmm all looks good to me

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3302</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no image
threads.message: heat and still no luck.. gonna get it replaced and see
